summary: This document is an email chain from July 3, 2020, between a potential witness/victim and FBI officials regarding the Epstein investigation. The witness, who experienced a rape 20 years prior, is proactively reaching out to provide information and requests a secure interview, preferably via Zoom. FBI officials acknowledge the communication and arrange for a case agent to make contact.

persons.name: EIM
persons.context: FBI Special Agent in Charge of the New York Criminal Division, who is copied on the email chain and acknowledges the witness's outreach, stating a case agent will make contact.

connections.description: W is a potential witness/victim providing information to FBI Assistant Director in Charge M regarding the Epstein investigation.
W's communication is forwarded to and acknowledged by FBI Special Agent in Charge EIM, who is overseeing the response.
Both are FBI officials in the New York Field Office coordinating on the response to the witness regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Witness outreach to FBI
events.description: A potential witness/victim (W) emails the FBI New York Field Office to provide information about a rape from 20 years ago that may be relevant to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Alleged rape of witness
events.description: The witness (W) references experiencing a rape 20 years prior to the 2020 email and had previously attempted to seek justice.

locations: New York (FBI New York Field Office)
West Coast (where witness W is located)
keyFacts: A potential witness/victim (W) contacted the FBI in July 2020 claiming to have information about a rape from 20 years prior that may help 'connect dots' in the Epstein investigation.
The witness expressed a preference for a Zoom interview over a phone call due to security concerns and past negative online experiences.

FBI officials from the New York Field Office, including an Assistant Director in Charge and a Special Agent in Charge, acknowledged the communication and initiated a process to have a case agent make contact.
The witness mentioned having lived under 'provable online threat for over 20 years,' though the threats had diminished by 2020.

The email chain shows the FBI's protocol for handling sensitive witness outreach during the Epstein investigation, noting security concerns preclude using platforms like LinkedIn or Zoom in some cases.
